data.title: 19 Most Popular Songs With Kiss in the Title, Ranked, Youtube Lyrics
data.meta_description: If you're a fan of romantic songs or love the feeling of a good kiss, this list of Most Popular Songs With Kiss in the Title is perfect for you!
data.meta_site_name: Greatest Songs - Sing Better - Musical Instruments
data.text:
So many amazing songs with “kiss” in the title make us feel all the emotions: from heartwarming love and romance to playful flirtation and even heartbreak.

If you’re a fan of romantic songs or love the feeling of a good kiss, this list of Most Popular Songs With Kiss in the Title is perfect for you!

We’ve compiled a selection of popular and iconic songs with “kiss” in the title.

1. “This Kiss” by Carly Rae Jepsen

“This Kiss” by Carly Rae Jepsen is a fun and upbeat song that perfectly captures the excitement and thrill of a new romantic attraction.

From the catchy beat to Jepsen’s playful vocals, this song celebrates the power of a simple kiss.

The lyrics are about the build-up and anticipation leading up to that special moment, with lines like “I just want one little taste” and “This kiss is something I can’t resist.”

2. “Shut Up and Kiss Me” by Mary Chapin Carpenter

“Shut Up and Kiss Me” by Mary Chapin Carpenter is a playful and flirtatious song that celebrates the magic of a kiss.

Released in 1994, this country-pop hit captures the excitement of being lost in a moment with someone special.

The lyrics talk about the rush of emotions that come with a passionate kiss, urging the listener to forget all worries and give in to the power of love.

3. “One Kiss” by Bryan Ferry

“One Kiss” by Bryan Ferry is a beautifully romantic song that captures the essence of being in love and the feeling of one single kiss.

This classic love ballad speaks to the power of a simple gesture, a kiss, that can ignite passion and evoke deep emotions.

The soft melody combined with dreamy instrumentals creates a sense of nostalgia and longing for that moment shared between two people.

4. “The Perfect Kiss” by Bette Midler

“The Perfect Kiss” by Bette Midler is a beautiful and romantic song that captures the essence of a perfect kiss.

It celebrates love and intimacy with lyrics that vividly depict two lovers sharing an unforgettable moment.

The soft melody and Bette Midler’s powerful vocals create a dreamy atmosphere, perfectly complementing the song’s message.

From the gentle guitar strumming to the longing in Bette Midler’s voice, every element comes together to make this song an enchanting experience.

5. “Kiss the Future” by The Human League

“Kiss the Future” by The Human League is a lively and upbeat song encouraging listeners to embrace the unknown and look forward to the future.

Its catchy melody and energetic beats invite us to let go of our fears and doubts and enjoy the present moment.

6. “Hold Me, Thrill Me, Kiss Me, Kill Me” by U2

“Hold Me, Thrill Me, Kiss Me, Kill Me” is a classic hit by the Irish rock band U2 and one of their most iconic songs.

Released in 1995 as part of the film soundtrack for “Batman Forever,” this song is about the intense and conflicting emotions often associated with love.

Bono’s powerful vocals and The Edge’s electrifying guitar riffs create an unforgettable experience for listeners.

7. “Kiss Me” by Sixpence None The Richer

“Kiss Me” by Sixpence None The Richer is a charming and romantic song that captivates listeners with its sweet and innocent lyrics.

The song describes the moment two people fall in love and want to share a kiss that will seal their love forever.

With catchy guitar riffs and dreamy vocals, this song has become an enduring anthem for young lovers.

It’s impossible not to feel butterflies when you hear lines like “kiss me beneath the milky twilight” or “kiss me down by the broken tree.”

8. “Kiss Me Deadly” by Lita Ford

“Kiss Me Deadly” is an electrifying rock song that captures the essence of love, passion, and danger. From its catchy guitar riffs to Ford’s powerful vocals, this song blends sensuality and edge.

The lyrics speak of a desire that is so intense that it can only be quenched by a kiss that is both deadly and addictive.

9. “Kiss From A Rose” by Seal

“Kiss From A Rose” by Seal is a captivating and soulful song that immediately captures your attention with its hauntingly beautiful melody.

This 1994 hit single has stood the test of time and continues to garner love and admiration from fans worldwide.

It revolves around the idea of a kiss being like a rose, fragile yet enduring, and how it can bring pleasure and pain.

10. “First Kiss” by Kid Rock

“First Kiss” by Kid Rock is a nostalgic and heartfelt song that takes listeners back to their first romantic encounter.

The lyrics beautifully capture the excitement, vulnerability, and sheer magic of a first kiss.

Kid Rock’s passionate vocals and country-rock sound create an irresistible combination that draws in the audience.

The melody is infectious and easygoing, making it impossible not to sing along.

The song paints a vivid picture of young love and captures the intensity of emotions felt during that moment, stirring up memories for anyone who has experienced it.

11. “In France They Kiss on Main Street” by Joni Mitchell

Released in 1974, “In France, They Kiss on Main Street” by Joni Mitchell is a charming song that captures the innocence and romance of young love.

The lyrics vividly depict a small European town where people freely show affection on the bustling main street.

Mitchell’s soulful voice and upbeat rhythm create nostalgia, making us yearn for simpler times.

The song celebrates the beauty of spontaneous kisses and carefree moments shared with loved ones. With each verse, we are transported to this idyllic French setting, where love prevails over everything else.

12. “Kiss Me In the Rain” by Barbra Streisand

“Kiss Me In the Rain” by Barbra Streisand is a timeless classic that captures young love’s romantic and sweet essence.

The song tells the story of two people caught in a moment of passion as they share a kiss under the pouring rain.

Streisand’s velvety voice transports us to this magical moment, painting a picture of pure bliss and eternal love.

With lyrics like “Hold me close, don’t let me go, I need you more than you will ever know,” the song perfectly captures the vulnerability and raw emotions of falling in love.

13. “Kiss Them For Me” by Siouxsie And The Banshees

“Kiss Them For Me” by Siouxsie And The Banshees is a unique and captivating song that captures the essence of love and longing.

The band’s infectious beat and haunting vocals tell a story of desire and unrequited love.

The lyrics paint a picture of someone deeply in love with another person but can’t express their feelings openly. Instead, they long for just one kiss, hoping it will convey all their emotions.

14. “This Kiss” by Faith Hill

“This Kiss” by Faith Hill is a romantic and upbeat song that celebrates the magic of a kiss.

The lyrics beautifully capture the feeling of being swept away by a kiss, with lines like “It’s the way you love me, it’s a feeling like this / It’s centrifugal motion, it’s perpetual bliss.”

The song conveys how a simple touch can ignite intense emotions and transport two people into a magical moment.

15. “Kiss” by Prince

“Kiss” by Prince is a mesmerizing song that celebrates a kiss’s magical and passionate feeling.

Released in 1986, this funky track has stood the test of time with its catchy beat and seductive lyrics. The playful and flirty tone of the songs perfectly captures the excitement and thrill of a new romance.

16. “Kiss On My List” by Hall & Oates

“Kiss On My List” is a classic 1980s hit by the iconic American duo Hall & Oates.

This upbeat and groovy track instantly became a fan favorite upon its release, topping charts and winning hearts worldwide.

The song narrates the story of two lovers who share an unbreakable bond and an undeniable chemistry sealed with a kiss.

With catchy melodies and smooth vocals, this song celebrates the simple yet powerful kissing act, declaring it the ultimate expression of love.

17. “Can We Kiss Forever?” by Kina feat. Adriana Proenza

“Can We Kiss Forever?” by Kina feat. Adriana Proenza is a beautiful and emotional song that explores the longing for a kiss that seems like it could last forever.

The hauntingly melodic vocals of both artists, combined with the dreamy production, create a sense of yearning and desire that is palpable throughout the entire song.

The lyrics tell the story of two individuals who are deeply in love and want nothing more than to be able to hold onto each other’s lips for eternity.

18. “Kiss and Say Goodbye” by The Manhattans

“Kiss and Say Goodbye” by The Manhattans is a timeless classic that has captivated listeners since it was released in 1976.

This soulful ballad tells the story of a man who knows he must end his relationship but finds it hard to let go.

He reminisces about the good times they shared and expresses regret for the pain he will cause by leaving.

19. “I’ll Kiss You” by Cyndi Lauper

“I’ll Kiss You” is a fun and playful song by the iconic Cyndi Lauper that celebrates the simple yet powerful act of kissing.

Released in 1997, this track exudes a carefree and romantic vibe, making it a timeless classic.

The upbeat tempo, catchy lyrics, and Cyndi Lauper’s signature raspy vocals make it impossible not to tap your feet and sing along.

The song beautifully captures the excitement and anticipation of a kiss, with Cyndi Lauper’s unapologetic declaration of wanting to be swept away in the moment.

20. “Kiss Me Quick” by Elvis Presley

“Kiss Me Quick” is an upbeat and playful song by the King of Rock and Roll, Elvis Presley. It’s a charming tune that perfectly captures the excitement and joy of being in love.

The lyrics are simple yet powerful, urging the listener to embrace every moment with their loved one and never let go.

With its catchy melody and iconic vocals, this song will make you want to dance and sing along.

FAQs

What 70s song has a Kiss in the title?

The 1970s was an iconic decade that gave us some of the best music in history. One common theme in many songs from this era is the presence of a kiss in the title.

Some notable titles include:

“Kiss and Say Goodbye” by The Manhattans,

“I Was Made for Lovin’ You” by Kiss themselves,

“Kiss You All Over” by Exile.

“Last Kiss” by J Frank Wilson & The Cavaliers,

“Kiss Me” by Sixpence None The Richer,

“Kiss on My List” by Hall & Oates.

What does kissing on the lips mean?

Kissing on the lips is a tender and intimate gesture that can have various meanings depending on the context and relationship between two people.

Generally, it signifies a strong emotional connection and attraction towards someone, whether romantic or platonic. It can also symbolize trust, affection, and deep love.

For couples in a romantic relationship, kissing on the lips can express desire, passion, and commitment towards each other.

However, it may represent a deep bond of friendship or familial love for friends or family members.

In some cultures and traditions, kissing on the lips is seen as a sign of respect or greeting among close acquaintances.

Regardless of its symbolism, kissing on the lips is an act that requires consent and should always be done with respect and care for the other person’s boundaries.

Did romantic kissing originate in India?

While there is no definitive answer to the origin of romantic kissing, it is believed by some that the practice may have originated in India.

Kissing has been mentioned in ancient Indian scriptures such as the Kama Sutra and has been an integral part of Indian culture for centuries.

It is also believed that during the Mughal era, the art of kissing spread to Europe through trade routes and was then adopted by Western cultures.

However, other theories suggest that romantic kissing existed in other civilizations, such as Ancient Greece and Rome.

Regardless of its exact origins, one thing is sure: romantic kissing has become a universal expression of love and affection across cultures, transcending boundaries and bringing people closer together.

How did kissing originate?

The act of kissing has been practiced worldwide across various cultures and periods.

Its origin is unclear, but many theories have been proposed to explain how kissing became a popular way of showing affection and love.

One theory suggests that kissing dates back to ancient times when mothers would chew food for their babies and pass it to them through mouth-to-mouth feeding.

This gesture was believed to symbolize an exchange of life force from mother to child.

Another theory points towards the ancient Romans, who shared a custom of rubbing noses together as a sign of affection and respect.

This practice spread to different parts of the world, evolving into what we now know as kissing.

Some also believe that kissing originated from early humans who used sniffing to greet each other, eventually turning into prolonged nose-to-nose contact and lip-to-lip contact.

Why do guys kiss with so much tongue?

The tongue is a sensitive organ that can heighten sensations and take the experience to another level.

The use of the tongue allows for a more passionate and intense kiss, as it allows for deeper exploration and connection between two people.

Additionally, it can communicate strong desire and attraction, making it an important aspect of physical intimacy.

Moreover, many men may have been influenced by media or peers to believe that using lots of tongues during kissing is seen as confident and masculine.

However, it’s important to remember that every individual has their preferences and boundaries regarding kissing.

Communication with your partner is key to finding what works best for both of you regarding using your tongue during kisses.

Conclusion

We hope this list of songs with “kiss” in the title has brought back some great memories.

Whether it’s a sweet, romantic kiss or a passionate one, these songs capture the essence of that special moment.

So when you’re feeling lovey-dovey or looking for a catchy tune to sing along to, give these songs a listen and let them transport you to a world of kisses.
